titles: The old woman's resolution: or, A dialogue betwixt Jack Drumbold and his Old Granny Gregory; who vow'd she would marry though fourscore years and ten because she would shoe her horse round. To the tune of I marry and thank ye too: Licensed according to order.
publisher: Printed for P[hilip]. Brooksby, J[onah]. Deacon, J[osiah]. Blare, J[ohn]. Back.,
notes: Verse: "There was an old woman then ..."
Date, place of publication, and publishers' names from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
